import { Meta, Title, Subtitle, Description, Primary, ArgTypes, Source, Stories } from '@storybook/addon-docs/blocks';
import * as StoriesFile from './CstateStatusToolWithBootstrap.stories';

<Meta of={StoriesFile} />

<Title>cState Status Tool (Bootstrap)</Title>
<Subtitle>Bootstrap-styled wrapper around the <code>cstate-status-tool</code> web component</Subtitle>

## Description

This page documents the Bootstrap-flavored story for the `cstate-status-tool` web component.
The story renders the component inside a Shadow DOM and imports Bootstrap 5 CSS via CDN
inside that Shadow DOM so the styles are scoped only to this story and do not affect
global Storybook styles.

Component tag: `cstate-status-tool`

## Usage

Below is a complete HTML example that mirrors the story. In this Storybook story, Bootstrap
is injected inside a Shadow DOM; in your own application, include Bootstrap in the way that
suits your setup.

<Source
  language="html"
  code={`<link
  href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.1.3/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css"
  rel="stylesheet"
/>

<cstate-status-tool base="data:application/json;base64,_  "
defaultDetails="Kurzbeschreibung der StÃ¶rung/Wartung ({{SYSTEMS}}).\n\nZeitpunkt: {{DATETIME}}\n\n{{STAND}}"                    

>
  <textarea name="content" slot="details-field" ></textarea>
  <input type="text" name="filename" slot="filename-field"  />
</cstate-status-tool>`}
/>

## Interactive example

<Primary />

## Properties / Attributes

- `base` (string): Data URL or URL pointing to the cState JSON index used by the tool.
- `defaultDetails` (string): Template for the default description text. Supports placeholders:
  `{{DATE}}`, `{{TIME}}`, `{{DATETIME}}`, `{{TYPE}}`, `{{SYSTEMS}}`, `{{STAND}}`.

<ArgTypes of={StoriesFile.WithBootstrap} />

## Notes

- In this story, Bootstrap 5 CSS is loaded inside a Shadow DOM to avoid affecting global Storybook styles.
- The component exposes slots `details-field` and `filename-field` for progressive enhancement; in this story,
  we project a `<textarea>` and an `<input>` into those slots.
